node.statement: Gauss Sum Nonvanishing: The generalized Gauss sum tau(pi, psi_Q) arising in the K-integral is nonzero because the conductor of the additive character psi_Q(x) = psi(Qx) (which has conductor q since Q generates q^{-1} and psi has conductor o) exactly matches the conductor of the multiplicative character of pi. This is a classical result: for GL_1, it is Tate thesis; for GL_n, it follows from the Godement-Jacquet theory of local epsilon factors. The essential Whittaker function value W^circ(diag(a,1)) at the selected torus element is nonzero by the Matringe-Miyauchi explicit formula.
